s.text: The chief cover story , countering basic conservative theology, argues that peace activism helped win the Cold War.
Each nation values liberalism in a different way.
A survey piece argues that Germany has replaced France as the dominant player in the European Union.
Nearly 30 homosexuals are featured in prime time, but few shows are sophisticated enough to script love lives for their homocharacters.
An editorial congratulates the Senate for killing the "arms control fantasies" of the Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty.

For instance, a ninth-century B.C. inscription memorializing a victory over the "House of David" provides material evidence of the Jewish king's existence, while the remains of a crucifixion victim indicate that the Romans would have killed Jesus as the gospels allege.
The piece echoes the familiar line that party members are a nut stew of United Nations haters, pot-legalizers, and campaign-finance reformers.
